The filling may seem a little bit runny, the
cream cheese filling, but the reason why it's

important that it's a little bit runny is
because you see how it oozes out, it's not

just in the very center, that cream cheese
filling is now over here, over here, it kind

of oozes out, that means that - see right
here?

You've got your cream cheese filling everywhere,
that means that almost every single bite of

your danish is going to have some of that
creamy delicious filling, but it's important

that you put these in the freezer for about
fifteen minutes so that filling can harden

a little bit before you pop it into the oven
because if you pop it straight into the oven,

that filling is going to ooze completely out
of your pastry and it's going to end up on

your baking sheet so don't be worried if it
seems a little bit runny.
I'm just going to cut this up a little bit.
